channel.title: Joining Datasets in Dremio on Dremio Modernization Workshop
channel.description: Recent content in Joining Datasets in Dremio on Dremio Modernization Workshop

item.title: Creating Physical Dataset
item.description: In Dremio, navigate to the Dremio Home Screen and click on your S3 bucket in the bottom left corner of the screen. Click on the same named “dremio-data-lake-AccountID” in the middle of the screen, then click on "dremioworkshopdata" and notice that you have a folder that says nyc weather. Click on the nyc weather folder and notice one Parquet file. We are going to convert this to a PDS by clicking “Format File” under Action.

item.title: Joining the Taxi & Weather Dataset
item.description: Navigate back to the data tab and click “join” located under the SQL Editor. Dremio allows you to join datasets using Inner, Left Outer, Right Outer or Full Outer joins. Dremio also provides the ability to recommend datasets to join based on past history. Since this is the first time we are joining a dataset, there are no recommendations. You will create a join by browsing for a Virtual Dataset.

item.title: Connect to Joined Dataset in Tableau
item.description:
In your Tableau workbook, navigate to the “Data Source” tab at the bottom of the screen.
Remove the NYC_Taxi table Refresh your Dremio connection to Tableau by clicking the refresh icon, located in the Tableau toolbar at the top of your screen.
Under Table on the left hand side, input “nyc_taxi_weather”, click the search icon and drag the table to the center of your screen.
